oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Martha White Show - Lester Flatt and the Nashville Grass - 1977-05-03 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Multiple recordings of Martha White Shows, featuring Grant Turner (host), Lester Flatt (host/performer), Kenny Ingram (performer), Benny Martin (performer), Marty Stuart (performer), the Nashville Grass (performers), and special guest John Hartford (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) First recording is from May 2-6, 1977 and second recording is from May 3, 1977.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Nashville Grass; Kenny Ingram; Lester Flatt; John Hartford; Benny Martin; Marty Stuart; Grandpa Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Lester Flatt talks about special guest John Hartford -- Lester Flatt introduces Kenny Ingram -- Flint Hill Special (Kenny Ingram banjo) -- Martha White commercial (Grant Turner and Lester Flatt) -- John Hartford talks -- Gentle On My Mind (John Hartford) -- Lester Flatt talks about Hartford and his recordings -- He Didn't Stop At Calvary (Lester Flatt) -- Martha White commercial (Grant Turner) -- Back Up And Push (Benny Martin fiddle) (incomplete) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Lester Flatt talks about special guest John Hartford -- Skipping In The Mississippi Dew (John Hartford) -- Lester Flatt talks about Benny Martin's playing -- Martha White commercial (Grant Turner) -- Milwaukee Here I Come (Benny Martin) -- Lester Flatt talks -- Turn Your Radio On (Lester Flatt) -- Trailblazer dog food commercial (Grant Turner and Grandpa Jones) -- I Don't Care Anymore (Kenny Ingram and Marty Stuart) [unconfirmed] -- Billy In The Lowground (Marty Stuart mandolin) -- Lester Flatt talks about Stuart's playing -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Grant Turner]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Flatt, Lester, 1914-1979; Nashville Grass (Musical group); Turner, Grant; Ingram, Kenny; Martin, Benny; Hartford, John; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Stuart, Marty;
